intro: Bambusa multiplex var. riviereorum, commonly known as the golden bamboo, is a clumping bamboo species native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its striking golden-yellow culms that contrast with its dark green leaves. This variety is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes. It prefers well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight. The plant is relatively low-maintenance and can thrive in a variety of climates.
